intro: Diodia rigida var. buchii, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its aromatic foliage and showy blooms make it a notable species in wetland ecosystems. It is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
